    Welcome to my website. Here you can find information about myself, my background, my research interests and links to all materials related to my projects.

    Biography

    Born and bred in Hong Kong. I read Biomedical Sciences in my undergraduate career at the University of Hong Kong where I first fall in love with bioinformatics, statistics and large-scale data analyses. In 2016 I was awarded a scholarship from the Croucher Foundation to do a PhD at Kingâ€™s College London where I stay on and from 2020 work as a Research Associate.

    I use and develop bioinformatics methods to mine and interpret large-scale datasets with the aim to understand the impact of mutations and sequence variations in cancers and the immune system. Read more about myself and details about my projects here.
